desc: Insertion sort treats an array as two subarrays: one sorted and one unsorted. The sorted subarray begins with just the first element, so it is 'sorted' from the start. It then iterates through the list, selecting the first element of the unsorted subarray and 'inserting' it into the proper spot of the sorted subarray. Once the final element is inserted, the list is sorted.
pseudo:
i = 1
while i < length(arr)
 j = i
 while j > 0 and arr[j-1] > arr[j]
  swap arr[j] and arr[j-1]
  j = j - 1
 i = i + 1
